content.1: The burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.
content.3: Why dost thou shew me iniquity, and cause
content.4: Therefore the law is slacked, and judgment doth never go forth: for the wicked doth compass about the righteous; therefore wrong judgment proceedeth.
content.5: Behold ye among the heathen, and regard, and wonder marvellously: for
content.6: For, lo, I raise up the Chaldeans,
content.8: Their horses also are swifter than the leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves: and their horsemen shall spread themselves, and their horsemen shall come from far; they shall fly as the eagle
content.9: They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup up
content.10: And they shall scoff at the kings, and the princes shall be a scorn unto them: they shall deride every strong hold; for they shall heap dust, and take it.
content.14: And makest men as the fishes of the sea, as the creeping things,
content.15: They take up all of them with the angle, they catch them in their net, and gather them in their drag: therefore they rejoice and are glad.
content.16: Therefore they sacrifice unto their net, and burn incense unto their drag; because by them their portion
content.17: Shall they therefore empty their net, and not spare continually to slay the nations?
